Coordinator Financial Accounting

Company Name Knox City Council Company Location Knox, AU

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 169 views

Job description

  • Annual remuneration package circa $115,000
  • Monthly RDO

Knox City Council is positioned in Melbourne’s picturesque eastern suburbs—reaching to the foothills of the Dandenong Ranges. Our staff of more than 1000 serves a diverse and vibrant population. Connected within 25 minutes of the city by the EastLink motorway, we attract professionals with a passionate commitment to our community and their vocation within an innovative culture of excellence.

If you are seeking to create a collaborative and innovative environment which encourages community and employee engagement, strives to be the best in its field, is passionate about its services, values and future, then you are looking in the right place!

This position contributes to the provision of high quality financial services to the City of Knox. The Coordinator Financial Accounting oversees all aspects of the day-to-day financial services functions including Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable, coordinates the preparation of the Annual Financial Report, manages the treasury function and the preparation of statutory returns including Business Activity Statements, Taxable Payments Annual Report and the Fringe Benefits Tax return, maintains the integrity of the general ledger and monitors and enhances internal controls.

Key Responsibilities
  • Effectively guide, support, co-ordinate and supervise the team’s employees in a manner that ensures the unit’s objectives are achieved.
  • Co-ordinate the preparation of Council's Annual Financial Report in a timely and effective manner.
  • Co-ordinate the Accounts Payable and Receivable functions.
  • Oversee the treasury function including cash flow reporting.
  • Maintain the integrity of the general ledger.
  • Co-ordinate the preparation of statutory returns including FBT, GST and grant acquittal reports.
  • Drive continued improvement and innovation in financial processes.


Applicants Must Have
  • Strong interpersonal skills.
    Demonstrated experience in a similar role in a dynamic organisation.
  • Commitment to service excellence and innovation.
  • Have, or be eligible for, CA/CPA Qualification.
  • Excellent attention to detail skills.

Application must include a cover letter, resume and responses addressing the selection criteria outlined within the Position Description.

Applications Close 11:45pm: 13 September 2018

Knox Council is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to providing a workplace that embraces diversity and inclusion. We are committed to a positive, barrier-free recruitment process. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application.

BDM - VIC/TAS

Company Name Schneider Electric Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 56 views

Job description

In 2018 Schneider Electric was ranked in the Top 10 places to work in Australia and top 25 globally! We offer a flexible work environment enabling you to take control of how you get your work done. We are global specialists in energy management and automation and our technologies ensure that Life Is On everywhere, for everyone at every moment.

Schneider Electric has a vast array of service offers covering all main product families including Low Voltage & Medium Voltage electrical switchgear, transformers, uninterruptible power supplies (UPS), computer room air-conditioning, chillers and variable speed drives (VSD).

Are you up to the challenge of joining a high performing national sales team, to make your mark and forge a career within a global organisation?

As the Services Business Development Manager for Western Australia, you will focus on pro-actively growing sales within Schneider’s life-cycle services business attached to new and existing install base.

Key service offers will include testing and commissioning, service contracts, spare parts packages, large on-demand mobilizations, asset-modernization and consulting services such as audits and assessments.

Whilst we do not want to narrow the field, we do believe that instrumental to your success in this role will be your demonstrated success in Business Development and sales growth within a turnkey / project sales environment.

You will be driven, possess excellent communications skills and high energy with a tactical hunting mentality when it comes to sales.

You have the ability to develop effective and strategic business partnerships with key end user contacts, consultants and contractors. Equally critical is your ability to listen and consult, your familiarity with what it takes to discover and pursue high value technical sales utilising all the resources at your disposal within a large matrix organisation to meet your customer’s unique business needs.

Your genuine passion for solutions and customer delivery and your team spirit will set you apart from the rest.

At Schneider Electric, our culture is achievement-driven, diverse and truly global and we offer development and career progression. We are open, we value differences, we listen, we learn, connect, and collaborate with others. We are proud to promote diversity, inclusion and work-life integration – we’re a great place to work but we are continually striving to be the best place to work, join us and see how!

#LifeIsOn

[

Senior Consultants/Managers and Senior Managers, Transaction Diligence, (Transaction Advisory Services) - Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane and Canberra

Company Name EY Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 130 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Our Transaction Advisory Services (TAS) team works with clients to manage their capital agenda to drive competitive advantage and increased returns. As part of a global team of 10,000 professionals in 100 countries you will advise clients on preserving, optimising, raising or investing capital. Major groups (or, as we call them, sub-service lines and competencies) within TAS include Mergers and Acquisition Services, Project Finance, Restructuring Services, Operational Transaction Services, Transaction Diligence, Transaction Tax, and Valuation and Business Modelling.

Join our Transaction Diligence team and you will work with many of the world’s largest organisations, fastest-growing companies and private equity firms on some of the most complex deals in the global market. Through analysis of financial, commercial and operational data, our industry-aligned transaction diligence professionals add true value to clients, providing insights to key decision-makers that help them increase value, and reduce the risks and uncertainty inherent in transactions. You will help to identify key value drivers, challenge assumptions about future performance, search for and advise on hidden value, and work with other EY service teams to deliver an integrated approach to our clients before, during and after the transaction.

With so many offerings, you have the opportunity to develop your career through a broad scope of engagements, mentoring and formal learning. That’s how we develop outstanding leaders who work together to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders, and in so doing, play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities. Sound interesting? Well this is just the beginning. Because whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

About You

In your role as a Manager/Senior Manager you will
  • Manage and participate in due diligence engagements related to acquisitions by private equity investor groups and strategic corporate buyers
  • Analyse financial/operational results of targets through reviewing accounting records and conducting interviews with management
  • Prepare/evaluate pro forma financial information
  • Identify issues that impact purchase price and deal structuring
  • Identify post-acquisition action steps to achieve anticipated earnings/cash flow improvements
  • Correlate due diligence findings with client valuations
  • Be responsible for project team management
  • Support the personal and professional development of junior staff
  • Identify business development opportunities and assist Partners and Directors on proposals and new business opportunities by participating in the proposal process, building client relationships and demonstrating knowledge of client business

We’re looking for people with the following experiences
  • A Bachelors or Masters degree in accounting, business, finance or economics preferred
  • At least 5 years for Manager applicants and 7 years for Senior Manager applicants, of related work experience, with transaction diligence or M&A transactions experience preferred, or a background in external audit or restructuring with more recent experience in transaction diligence
  • A member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants, or international equivalent
  • Strong analytical and interpersonal skills
  • Highly effective written and verbal communication skills and a dedication to teamwork
  • A strong work ethic and the ability to adapt to new challenges and ideas in a collaborative team environment

About Us

EY is a global professional services organisation providing advisory, assurance, tax and transaction advisory services. We are committed to doing our part in building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. And we are united by our shared values and a dedication to delivering exceptional client service.

Interested?

When you work at EY, you learn how to be part of a high performing team that works together to tackle client issues. And you create the relationships with clients and colleagues that will continue to build your career – wherever that career may take you. The time you spend with us is never spent, but instead invested in your future. Apply today.

Excited? Get to know us better.

Visit www.ey.com/careers

The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by Ernst & Young or a recruitment partner.

\xa9 2018 Ernst & Young, Australia. All Rights Reserved

Service Desk Analyst

Company Name Ethan Group Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 126 views

Job description

The Company


Ethan Group is one of the largest privately-owned service providers within the Australian ICT industry. Known for our entrepreneurial spirit and can-do culture, we pride ourselves on our innovative thinking and best-in-class service.


We need a competent Service Desk Analyst to join our growing Global Service Desk Team; who is available to work on a 24/7 rotating work roster, to ensure that customer service is provided at the highest standard, within contracted service level agreements and scope of contracts.


Our Service Desk Analysts are tasked with being the first technical contact on support issues and a key objective is to provide first call fix capabilities to callers and other electronically submitted requests in order to fulfil client demand and achieve business objectives.

\xa0

Roles & Responsibilities:


Key responsibilities include:


  • Identify and resolve requests for technical assistance via phone and remote support tools, in an effective and timely manner;
  • Analyse, identify, diagnose, and troubleshoot user desktop technical issues and network faults;
  • Perform desktop and server administration, configurations, software installations, upgrades, maintenance and backups;
  • Perform basic administration tasks (such as password resets, account creations/deletions) as defined in the specific customer configuration work rules;
  • Document all service desk interactions in our ITSM tool (Connectwise);
  • Participate in creating technical documents and uploading into knowledge base; and
  • Identify and escalate more complex problems or urgent situations to appropriate senior resources or other departments.


Skills, Experience & Qualifications

  • Previous experience as a Service Desk Agent or Customer Service Representative desirable;
  • Experience with Microsoft Office Suite 2007, 2010, 2013, Microsoft Active Directory, Exchange and Citrix;
  • Understanding of Network troubleshooting for ADSL routers, and using service support systems;
  • Previous use of ConnectWise ITSM tool or another similar ticketing system preferred;
  • ITIL Qualification or ITIL exposure preferred; and
  • Industry vendor certifications highly regarded (Microsoft MCP, CISCO, Citrix etc).


Desired Personal Attributes:


  • Must have strong time management skills and the ability to perform well under pressure handling simultaneous assignments;

  • Ability to deal with difficult customers and build sound relationships with key stakeholders;

  • Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills;

  • Strong critical thinking ability and problem resolution skills;

  • Strong procedural and organisational skills, paying high attention to detail; and

  • A strong team player, who is willing to contribute to achieving team and organisational objectives.



Do you meet the above selection criteria? Would you like to be rewarded in line with your qualifications and experience? Are you interested in an opportunity to grow in your role whilst working in a fun, engaged and flexible environment?


If yes, then this is the opportunity for you! Apply today for this exciting position with Ethan Group.


Ethan Group strongly encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates to apply.



*No Agencies, Thank You**

AU-Genius

Company Name Apple Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 24 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At the Apple Store, you maintain customers’ trust in Apple as the skilled expert, troubleshooting and repairing products. You use problem-solving and people skills to assure Genius Bar customers of swift resolutions to their technical problems. You also educate your team members about products, while independently keeping your own technical know-how up to date. With your customer service brilliance and empathetic nature, you provide Genius advice and support every day.

Description

As a Genius, you provide insightful advice and friendly, hands-on technical support to Apple customers in need. You quickly diagnose product issues on the spot, explaining situations with patience and empathy. After determining whether repairs can be done or a replacement is needed, you offer solutions to quickly get users up and running again. Even if you’re juggling more than one customer, you stay conscious of their time demands as well as your own. You fulfil Apple’s service commitment with style, speed and skill. And you earn the trust of customers and co-workers alike as you offer guidance, knowledge, and even tips and training.

Key Qualifications

Strong people skills and a knack for problem solving.
Ability to maintain composure and customer focus while troubleshooting and solving technical issues.
Ability to adhere to a schedule of customer appointments.

Additional Requirements
  • You have an aptitude for acquiring skills in technical repairs and an eagerness to learn.
  • You have excellent time management skills and can make decisions quickly.
  • You’ll need to be flexible with your schedule. Your work hours will be based on business needs.

[

Merchandise Planner - Apparel and General Merchandise

Company Name Kmart Australia Limited Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 5 days ago Number of views 155 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At Kmart, families come first for the lowest prices on everyday items, and our vision is to make everyday living brighter for all of our customers, every time and everywhere they shop with us.

As Australia’s brightest retail star, we have experienced great success in recent times but for Kmart this is just the beginning of our exciting journey ahead! We have big plans in place to ensure we deliver our vision and significantly expand our business. With another 40 new stores opening across Australia and New Zealand, the growth of our online business and expansion into new markets, we are on a mission to improve the Kmart shopping experience for all our customers, who are at the heart of everything we do. There has never been a more irresistible time to join Kmart!

Due to growth in our Planning team we are now seeking to recruit Merchandise Planners across our apparel and general merchandise portfolios.

Based at our Head Office in Mulgrave and reporting into a Planning Manager, in this role you will:

  • deliver key profit objectives through innovation, customer orientation, inventory management and analysis
  • work closely with your buyer and the broader team
  • be a significant contributor in executing the strategy
  • trade your business to maximise every opportunity and minimise risks
  • control a significant Open to Buy
  • forecast stock requirements to maximise revenue, margin and stock turn performance

Irresistible You!

As an experienced Merchandise Planner, you will have a solid knowledge base, an inquisitive and commercial mind and enjoy knowledge sharing. Working collaboratively is your preferred style but you are comfortable owning your business and decision making.

Driven to succeed, you have demonstrated business acumen and exceptional commercial results; excel in forecasting, interpreting market trends and executing strategic trading plans to exceed targets and deliver growth.

You are a well-regarded trader, strong communicator and influencer, with a proactive approach. Strong computer literacy, including proficiency in Excel is essential.

Irresistible Kmart!

We are a huge volume retailer and we do things a little differently around here! We will support you in learning the Kmart way but we will also give you the accountability and ownership you crave. Kmart is a company that will give you the opportunity to gain experience outside of your comfort zone, where you can develop professionally and truly own your career!

You will benefit from joining an amazing business and a dynamic team who are all committed to the success of Kmart and providing our customers with a great shopping experience. Our values – Think Customer, Take Care, Live Integrity, Grow Together and Reach Higher will resonate with you deeply and you’ll enjoy being part of a growing, iconic Australian business that has a fantastic culture that is non-hierarchical, diverse and inclusive. Your work environment will be highly collaborative, fast-paced and progressive, with no two days the same!

You will be afforded autonomy and accountability in your role and have access to development opportunities across both Kmart and the Wesfarmers Group, excellent remuneration, an uncapped bonus scheme & access to Wesfarmers share plan (both for eligible team members), free parking and benefits program including a discount card for Kmart, Coles, Target and Officeworks.

So if this sounds like the perfect role for you – apply now!

At Kmart we aim to ensure our teams reflect the diversity of the communities in which we operate.

Candidates interested in this position should apply directly to this advertisement as we are not accepting applications from recruitment agencies.
